<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

I have labelled this as an issue with arpack-ng, as that is the package that I am having trouble building, but I suspect the underlying issue is with intel-mkl.

### Steps to reproduce the issue
I have installed intel-parallel-studio following instructions at https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_systems/intelpackage.html#install-steps-for-packages-with-compilers-and-libraries.  I want to use fftw-api via MKL, but intel-parallel-studio does not support that, so I installed intel-parallel-studio with ~mkl and install intel-mkl separately, and then try to install arpack-ng.

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
( add a stub entry for intel@20.0.1 in compilers.yaml)
$ spack install intel-parallel-studio@cluster.2020.1%intel@20.0.1 +advisor+clck+daal+gdb~ilp64+inspector+ipp+itac~mkl+mpi+newdtags+rpath+shared+tbb+vtune auto_dispatch=none threads=openmp
(this installs w/out issue.  Fix paths to compilers, etc in compilers.yaml)
$spack install intel-mkl@2020.1.217%intel@20.0.1   ~ilp64+shared threads=tbb
(this installs w/out issue)
$arpack-ng@3.7.0%intel@20.0.1 ~mpi+shared arch=linux-rhel8-ivybridge
(this fails with errors like)
/.../linux-rhel8-ivybridge/intel-20.0.1/intel-mkl-2020.1.217-.../compilers_and_libraries_2020.1.217/linux/mkl/lib/intel64/libmkl_tbb_thread.so: undefined reference to `tbb::task_group_context::cancel_group_execution()
```
My environment includes
```console
providers:
      blas: [intel-mkl]
      fftw-api: [intel-mkl]
      mkl: [intel-mkl]
      lapack: [intel-mkl]
      scalapack: [intel-mkl]
      tbb: [intel-parallel-studio+tbb]
```
so intel-mkl is used for blas/lapack/et al, and intel-parallel-studio for tbb.

It looks like intel-mkl has a dependency on tbb (which is expected since I gave it threads=tbb), but it is not declaring it in spack (i.e. spack info intel-mkl does *not* show a tbb dependence).

The IntelPackage build system is a bit overwhelming to me, but I tried adding a simple depends_on clause to depend on tbb when threads=tbb to the intel-mkl package.py, but in that test case the spec wanted intel-tbb (despite my environment stating I wanted intel-parallel-studio to provide tbb).  

1) Shouldn't intel-mkl threads=tbb depend on tbb?
2) How does one fix the issue with unresolved tbb symbols in libmkl_tbb_thread.so?
### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
```console
spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.2
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel8-ivybridge
```
My environment's spack.yaml includes
```consoleackages:
  all:
    compiler:: [intel@20.0.1]
    providers:
      blas: [intel-mkl]
      fftw-api: [intel-mkl]
      mkl: [intel-mkl]
      lapack: [intel-mkl]
      scalapack: [intel-mkl]
      daal: [intel-parallel-studio+daal]
      ipp: [intel-parallel-studio+ipp]
      tbb: [intel-parallel-studio+tbb]
      ...
```
and the full spec of the arpack-ng I am installing is:
[spec.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5269999/spec.txt)


<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5270001/spack-build-env.txt)
* [spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5270002/spack-build-out.txt)

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
I cannot find any maintainers for arpack-ng, intel-mkl, or intel-parallel-studio

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x ] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x ] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
